Phil first encounters the yellow-bellied glider, an intrepid marsupial with a built-in wingsuit. Next is one of Australia‚Äôs most abundant but deadly reptiles, the eastern brown snake. Last but certainly not least, Phil finds the iconic, cuddly and oh-so-sleepy koala.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Within the Channel Country deserts, Indigenous educator Phil Breslin scours the endless sands to find three animals that not only survive the heat but thrive in unrelenting conditions. Get ready to meet Australia‚Äôs most impressive animals: the perentie, the continent‚Äôs largest lizard; the emu, its fastest flightless bird; and the mighty red kangaroo, the world‚Äôs largest marsupial.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin ventures into Australia‚Äôs notorious wetlands to discover three animals built for the muggy and wet environment. Phil comes face to face with the uniquely Australian freshwater crocodile, a massive predatory fish called the barramundi, and the saltwater crocodile, one of the world‚Äôs most dangerous animals and largest reptiles.

programme.title: Dr. Oakley, Yukon Vet
programme.desc: While Dr. Oakley awaits a litter of puppies, she hits the road to treat a stubborn bison, and a moose with a respiratory issue. In the clinic, she checks a Great Dane's swollen leg.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: With the arrival of spring, animals from all over the South Atlantic are suddenly converging on the Falklands. The striated cara-cara is one of the few year-round inhabitants of the islands.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: Each year, monarch butterflies undertake a multi-generational migration from Mexico all the way to Canada and back again. .

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: The coastal realm of land and sea is home to two of nature‚Äôs most iconic females ‚Äì orca and grizzly bears. Under the waves in the Gulf of California, the orca family‚Äôs success relies on the experience of their sixty-year-old matriarch; while on the beaches of Alaska, a first-time bear mother must raise her three cubs alone and with only her instincts to guide her.

programme.title: Animals Gone Wild
programme.desc: How outrageous can the animal kingdom get? Whether its out-of-bounds behavior or savage instincts run amok, when animals act out, theyre a force to be reckoned with. From the mysterious depths of the deep blue sea to the jungles untamed edge, see just how rough, rowdy, and lawless Mother Natures most unruly creatures can be.

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: The African Savanna is home to the ultimate animal sisterhood; a family of elephants. A new baby will need the family‚Äôs support to make it through her early vulnerable months. While mom learns how to care for her, it is the baby‚Äôs grandmother, the matriarch, that must protect her. Facing predators, drought and a rapidly changing world can this new baby and her family of iconic females survive?.

programme.title: Animals Gone Wild
programme.desc: When your number's up, it's up. Or is it? When fight or flight instincts kick in, anything is possible, and animals will do anything to survive. From heroic acts of bravery to narrow escapes and near misses, expect the unexpected when creatures big and small encounter the animal kingdom's strangest curve balls in Animals Gone Wild: Shock & Awe.

programme.title: Animals Gone Wild
programme.desc: From the deepest seas to the tallest mountains, animals continuously surprise us and prove yet again that when it comes to Mother Nature, there is always an exception to the rule. These animals go against the grain, whether cheating death or forming odd friendships- it's Animals Gone Wild: Surprisingly Human. .

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: In the heart of Tanzania, the towering walls of the Ngorongoro crater sets a stage for one of the most infamous rivalries in the natural world. The sisters of a formidable lion pride clash with a hyena clan ruled by an all-powerful queen. The sisterhood share responsibility, while the hyena queen must play clan politics and enforce a strict hierarchy to keep her crown.

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: Under the rainforest canopy of Central America is a secret world ruled by insects. Two tiny queens will give everything to build their empires. The ant queen will sacrifice her own body for the future of her growing colony while the beautiful orchid bee will stop at nothing for success; betraying those closest to her.

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: The Congo Forest in Central Africa is home to a secretive animal we still know very little about. Bonobos are one of our closest relatives, but in their society it‚Äôs females who rule. A young bonobo must leave behind her family, to find her place in the world. Here, friendship is the key to survival. She must make new friends and impress the alpha female before she can truly fit in.

programme.title: Queens

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol: Compilation
programme.desc: From biology to toxicology to pathology, science is at the forefront when healing ailing pets. Dr. Pol uses his scientific knowledge to determine why a senior horse is losing weight. Dr. Lisa employs charcoal to save a poisoned pooch, while Dr. Nicole decodes bloodwork to find the culprit for a cat‚Äôs illness.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol: Compilation
programme.desc: The holidays are here and the docs gifting a whole lot of TLC! From a roundup of ailing reindeer and a dashing dachshund-basset hound with mysterious lumps, to a lab mix with an interesting appetite and a down horse with a hopeful outlook, this Pol-iday season finds the vets miracle hands at work!.

programme.title: Animal Genius
programme.desc: Biologist Liz Bonnin travels the world in search of the genius ways animals survive. Teaming up with world-leading experts, Liz unpacks the latest science on animals we thought we knew. From a unique meerkat language in Africa‚Äôs Kalahari Desert to the secret behind baby sea turtles hatching in unison on the beaches of Mexico, Liz hopes to discover the secrets behind their effective teamwork.

programme.title: America's Wild Spaces
programme.desc: We will travel from South to North and explore the remotest corners of the Appalachian Trail and meet the scientists fighting to keep this wilderness wild. .

programme.title: Born In Africa
programme.desc: Each species follows a different rhythm of growth, and this applies to the learning process. As the days go by, we will witness each of our characters' progress and missteps. .
